definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale

sentences.english: There is a drugstore around the corner.
There is an art theatre round the corner.
sentences.chinese: 在街拐角有一所藝術劇院。

sentences.english: An overpass is being put up at the corner of the street.
sentences.chinese: 在那條街的拐角處正在建起一個過街天橋。

sentences.english: They got a Blacks down the corner, I think, as well.
sentences.chinese: 拐角處還有一個Blacks品牌店。

sentences.english: One restaurant is on the corner of Main Street and Park Lane.
sentences.chinese: 一家在主街和公園路的拐角處。

sentences.english: There is a pillar box at the street corner.
Follow this road to the corner.
sentences.chinese: 順着這條路走到拐角處。

sentences.english: The bank around the corner was knocked over last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜裏位於拐角的那家銀行被搶了。

sentences.english: The glass mountain stands at the corner of Thirteenth Street and Eighth Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃山矗立於第十三街和第八十大道的拐角處。

sentences.english: He walked nervously to the corner and hurried down a side street.
sentences.chinese: 他緊張地走到拐角處，彎進一條小街，匆匆走去。

sentences.english: There stands one on the corner.
The car turned left at the corner and disappeared from our view.
sentences.chinese: 汽車在拐角處向左拐，然後就從我們的視線中消失了。

sentences.english: There's a building guarded by the local militia at the corner of the street.
sentences.chinese: 街道拐角處有一幢由當地民兵團守衛的大樓。

sentences.english: Drop us off at the corner.
About three hundred yards farther on there is a turning to the left.
sentences.chinese: 再往前大約300碼有一個向左拐的拐角。

definition: bend in a street/corner/to turn a corner
head of a flight of stairs
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
